TunableTuple.description: Tests for object locations. Outside: Check if an object is on the inside or outside (has a roof over its head) Natural ground: Checks the floor tiles where the object is to see if it qualifies as natural ground

TunableVariant.name: has_terrain_tag
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is currently on the tuned terrain tag.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: , A set of terrain tags required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will be inverted. In other words, the test will fail if at least one tag is detected at this location.

TunableList.name: terrain_tags
TunableList.description: A set of terrain tags. Only one of these tags needs to be present at this location. Although it is not tunable, there is a threshold weight underneath which a terrain tag will not appear to be present.

Tunable.name: test_floor_tiles
Tunable.description: If checked, floor tiles will be tested. Otherwise, it'll only check the terrain and will ignore the floor tiles on the terrain.

TunableVariant.name: in_common_area
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject is in the common area of an apartment. If unchecked will verify the subject is not.

TunableVariant.name: is_fire_allowed
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if fire is possible at the subject's position. If unchecked, will pass if fire is not possible. If not enabled, doesn't care either way.

TunableVariant.name: is_in_slot
TunableVariant.description: If enabled will test if the object is attacked/deattached to any of possible tuned slots. If you tune a slot type set the test will test if the object is slotted or not slotted into into any of those types.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test if an object is current slotted in any of a possible list of slot types. Empty slot type set is allowed for testing for slotted or not slotted only.

TunableVariant.name: slot_test_type
TunableVariant.description: Strategy to test the slots: Any Slot - is the object in any slot Surface Slot - is object is in a surface slot Specific Slot - is the object in specific list of slots

TunableTuple.name: any_slot
TunableTuple.description: Singleton factory for testing if object is slotted.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

TunableTuple.name: specific_slot
TunableTuple.description: Subclass of SlotTestType that can check against a specific slot set.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

Tunable.name: specific_slot_set
Tunable.description: Set of slots the object may be attached to.

TunableTuple.name: surface_slot
TunableTuple.description: Subclass of SlotTestType that checks that a slot has is_surface set to true.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

TunableVariant.name: is_inside_building
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject of the test is inside a building. This uses a client function that checks if the block the sim is mostly enclosed by walls or if not, if the adjoining blocks are themselves enclosed. This should be used when we want to test if a subject is inside a normally constructed building. If we simply want to test whether the subject is covered / has a roof over them, use is_outside. See comment on is_outside for more details. If unchecked, will negate this test.

TunableVariant.name: is_natural_ground
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is on natural ground (no floor tiles are under him). Otherwise, will verify the subject of the test is not on natural ground.

TunableVariant.name: is_on_active_lot
TunableVariant.description:
If disabled the test will not be used. If enabled and checked, the test will pass if the subject is on the active lot. (their center is within the lot bounds) If enabled and not checked, the test will pass if the subject is outside of the active lot.
For example, Ask To Leave is tuned with this enabled and checked for the TargetSim. You can only ask someone to leave if they are actually on the active lot, but not if they are wandering around in the open streets.

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_on_active_lot
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not On Active Lot

Tunable.name: include_spawn_point
Tunable.description: If set to true, we will consider the lot's spawn point as part of the active lot.

Tunable.name: is_or_is_not_on_active_lot
Tunable.display: Is Or Is Not On Active Lot
Tunable.description: If checked then the test will pass if the subject is on the active lot.

Tunable.name: explicit
Tunable.description: The tolerance from the edge of the lot that the location test will use in order to determine if the test target is considered on lot or not.

TunableTuple.name: use_default_tolerance
TunableTuple.description: Use the default tuned global offlot tolerance tuned in objects.components.statistic_component.Default Off Lot.

TunableVariant.name: is_on_level
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we check the participant's current level against the tuned threshold. In the case of sims in pools, the effective level will be that of the surface of the pool, not the bottom.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: is_outside
TunableVariant.description: PLEASE BE AWARE. If checked, will verify if the subject of the test does not have a roof over their head. If unchecked, will test if the subject has a roof over their head. If the intention is to determine if a subject is in/not in a building, this test is deprecated in favor of is_inside_building. If you would like to test if a subject is inside a building, but also need to test if they have a roof over their head, please use both options.

TunableVariant.name: is_venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject is at a venue of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Venue type required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will return true if the subject IS NOT at a venue of the specified type.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

Tunable.name: venue_type
Tunable.description: Venue type to test against.

TunableVariant.name: valid_surface_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will test the surface type of the subject against prohibited or required surface types.

TunableTuple.name: Test_Surface_Types
TunableTuple.description: Required and Prohibited Surface Types.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableTuple.name: locked_portal_count
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks the number of locked doors.

TunableVariant.name: lock_priority
TunableVariant.description: The priority of the locks we want to test. None means all priorities.

TunableVariant.name: lock_types
TunableVariant.description: The type of the locks we want to test. None means all types.

TunableTuple.name: number_to_test
TunableTuple.description: The number of doors that need to be locked to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: lot_owner
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by whether a sim owns the lot the object is on or not.

Tunable.name: consider_business_lot_as_owned
Tunable.description: If checked, business lots are considered owned. If unchecked, business lots are considered unowned.

Tunable.name: consider_rented_lot_as_owned
Tunable.description: If checked, rented lots are considered owned. If unchecked, rented lots are considered unowned.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will return the opposite of what it's tuned to return. For instance, if this test is tuned to return True if the active household owns the lot, but "Invert" is checked, it will actually return False.

Tunable.name: owns_lot
Tunable.description: If checked and subject owns the current lot then this test will pass. If unchecked, subject does not own lot, this test will pass.

TunableTuple.name: mood
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if a Sim has the requested mood.

Tunable.name: disallow
Tunable.description: If True, this test will pass if the Sim's mood does NOT match the tuned mood reference.

Tunable.name: mood
Tunable.description: The mood that must be active (or must be inactive, if 'Disallow' is checked).

TunableTuple.name: motive
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that checks one or many statistics against a threshold.

TunableList.name: stats
TunableList.description: The stat we are operating on.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: nearby_floor_feature
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that checks if a specified floor feature is within a radius of a given actor.

TunableEnum.name: floor_feature
TunableEnum.description: The floor feature type that is required to be inside the radius_actor's radius.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius, with the radius actor's position, that defines the area within which the floor feature is valid.

TunableTuple.name: object_criteria
TunableTuple.description: A test to look at all the objects and compare them to the tuned criteria.

Tunable.name: completed
Tunable.description: If checked, any craftable object (such as a painting) must be finished for it to be considered.

TunableVariant.name: desired_state_threshold
TunableVariant.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object in order to determine if it matches or not.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: on_active_lot
Tunable.description: If checked, test whether or not the object is on the active lot. If unchecked the object can be either on the active lot or in the open streets area, we don't really care.

Tunable.name: owned
Tunable.description: If checked will test if the object is owned by the active household. If unchecked it doesn't matter who owns the object or if it is owned at all.

TunableVariant.name: positional_relationship_test
TunableVariant.description: The type of positional relationship test to run on the object with respect to another object.

TunableTuple.name: radius_test
TunableTuple.description: The object must be within a certain radius of a tuned participant in order for the test to pass.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius, with the radius actor's position, that defines the area within which the object is valid.

TunableEnum.name: radius_actor
TunableEnum.description: The actor whose position, with the radius, defines the area within which the object is valid.

TunableTuple.name: tagged_object_on_same_level_test
TunableTuple.display: Tagged Object On Same Level Test
TunableTuple.description: The object must has at least one object with a tuned tag on the same level as a tuned participant in order for the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to test against.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: A single tag to find an object matching to test against the participant.

TunableVariant.name: sim_ownership
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the object is owned by the active Sim. If checked, test will pass if the Sim owns the object.

TunableTuple.name: quantity
TunableTuple.description: The number of objects that meet the tuned critera needed to pass this test. quantity is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: total_value
TunableVariant.description: If set, the total monetary value of all the objects that meet the tuned criteria needed in order to pass this test. total_value is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: If set, the total monetary value of all the objects that meet the tuned criteria needed in order to pass this test. total_value is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: If set this test will loop through the specified participants and run the object identity and criteria tests on them instead of all of the objects on the lot.

TunableList.name: test_events
TunableList.description:
The list of events that trigger this instance of the tuned test on.
If you pick ObjectStateChange, the test will be registered with EventManager for every ObjectStateValue managed by ObjectState controlling the desired_state_threshold. E.g. if the test cares about BrokenState_Broken, we will register tolisten for events for state changes of BrokenState_Broken, BrokenState_Unbroken, BrokenState_Repairing, etc.

Tunable.name: use_depreciated_values
Tunable.description: If checked, the value consideration for each checked object will at its depreciated amount. This affects the "All Objects" test type, changing the total value considered to be at the non-depreciated amount.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: A threshold test for the monetary value of a single object in order for it to be considered.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: ranked_statistic
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether or not a statistic is at a certain threshold for a given participant.

Tunable.name: must_have_ranked_stat
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sim actually has the ranked statistic referenced. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sim had the ranked statistic at the value of 0

TunableVariant.name: num_participants
TunableVariant.description: If disabled, all participants must pass this stat test. If enabled, we test against this number for the number of participants that need this value of stat to pass.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The threshold of the number of participants who must meet the criteria individually.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: ranked_stat
Tunable.description: The ranked stat we are operating on.

Tunable.name: test_against_highest_rank
Tunable.description: When checked this test will only return True is the highest rank achieved is in the threshold specified, and not the current rank.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableTuple.name: state_value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The state threshold for this test.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the ranked statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: relationship
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by a relationship status.

Tunable.name: invert_num_relations
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check that your Num Relations is less than or equal to the value rather than the other way around.

Tunable.name: num_relations
Tunable.description:
Number of Sims with specified relationships required to pass, default(0) is all known relations.
If value set to 1 or greater, then test is looking at least that number of relationship to match the criteria.
If value is set to 0, then test will pass if relationships being tested must match all criteria of the test to succeed. For example, if interaction should not appear if any relationship contains a relationship bit, this value should be 0.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableList.name: target_sim
TunableList.description: Target(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableVariant.name: test_incest
TunableVariant.description: Test for incest status. Test passes if this matches the two Sim's incest status.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: If set, the test will use the relationship score between sims for this track. If unset, the track defaults to the global module tunable REL_INSPECTOR_TRACK.

TunableTuple.name: season
TunableTuple.description: SeasonTest will test if the current simulation time falls within the specified test conditions.

Tunable.name: requires_seasons_pack
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will require that the Seasons pack be installed in order for the seasons test to pass. If unchecked, this test will automatically pass.

TunableList.name: seasons
TunableList.description: Season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: time_of_season
TunableVariant.description: Portion(s) of season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Portion(s) of season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: sim_filter
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that checks to see if a sim matches a given filter.

Tunable.name: duration_available
Tunable.description: The duration from now that will be used for the start and end time of the filter request.

TunableEnum.name: relative_sim
TunableEnum.description: The sim that will be the relative sim that the filter will check against for relative checks such as relationships or household ids.

TunableVariant.name: threshold_matched
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, we will require the number of Sims that match the filter pass the threshold requirement. Otherwise we require all Sims that the filter runs on to match.
This is useful if you only need one or a number of Sims to match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A threshold of how many sims should match the filter.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold for how many Sims should match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: sim_info
TunableTuple.description: The SimInfo tests some of the basic aspects of a Sim, such as their age, gender, or species.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: can_age_up
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

Tunable.name: specified
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableVariant.name: has_been_played
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableVariant.name: is_active_sim
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description:
When testing multiple participants if MATCH_ALL is set, then all the participants need to pass the test.
If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass as soon as one of them meet the criteria

TunableVariant.name: npc
TunableVariant.description:
Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.
Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.
Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

TunableTuple.name: specified
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableTuple.name: specified_extended
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableTuple.name: situation_job
TunableTuple.description: Require the tuned participant to have a specific situation job. If multiple participants, ALL participants must have the required job to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then the test result will be reversed, so it will test to see if they are not in a job or not in role state that has matching tags.

TunableList.name: role_tags
TunableList.description: The participant must have a job that matches the role_tags or have the situation_job.

TunableList.name: situation_jobs
TunableList.description: The participant must have this job in this list or a job that matches the role_tags.

TunableTuple.name: situation_running
TunableTuple.description: A test to see if the participant is part of any situations that are running that satisfy the conditions of the test.

Tunable.name: check_for_initiating_sim
Tunable.description: If checked, the situation must be initiated by the tuned Participant.

TunableVariant.name: level
TunableVariant.description: A check for the level of the situation we are checking.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A check for the level of the situation we are checking.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: The subject of this situation test.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation test.

TunableVariant.name: situation_blacklist
TunableVariant.description: Blacklisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tag in Tag Blacklist, will cause this test to fail.

TunableVariant.name: situation_whitelist
TunableVariant.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tags in Tag Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If no situations are specified in this whitelist, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tags in Tag Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If no situations are specified in this whitelist, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableList.name: tag_blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted situations, specified by this set of tags or by references in Situation Tag Blacklist, will cause this test to fail.

TunableVariant.name: tag_whitelist
TunableVariant.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of tags or by references in Situation Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If this whitelist is not enabled, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description:
The test event that this test will run on when tuned within an objective or the main goal trigger of a sitaution.
If you are tuning this on an interaction then it will do nothing.

TunableTuple.name: skill_tag
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that checks the TAGS of ALL THE PARTICIPANTS SKILLS each against a threshold.

Tunable.name: skill_quantity
Tunable.description: The minimum number of skills at or above this level required to pass.

TunableEnum.name: skill_tag
TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableTuple.name: skill_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold level to test of each skill.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: test_only_changed_skill
Tunable.description: If checked then we will only test the skill that actually changed.

TunableTuple.name: skill_test
TunableTuple.description: A test requiring a Sim to have a skill that is either above a threshold or within an interval.

Tunable.name: skill
Tunable.description:
The skill to test against.
Should the Sim not have the specified skill, or should the skill not be available because of pack restrictions, this Sim will be considered at level 0.

TunableVariant.name: skill_range
TunableVariant.description: A skill range defined by either an interval or a threshold.

TunableTuple.description: A TunableThreshold that is specifically used in Skill Range Tests to determine if a skill meets the required skill level.

TunableTuple.name: skill_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range (inclusive) a skill level must be in to pass this test.

Tunable.name: lower_bound

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: A TunableThreshold that is specifically used in Skill Range Tests to determine if a skill meets the required skill level."

TunableTuple.name: skill_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The Threshold for the skill level to be valid.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill_level
Tunable.description: If checked, then instead of using the skill's actual level, the test will use the skill's effective level for the purpose of satisfying the specified criteria.

TunableTuple.name: state
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by object state. By default, the test will use the state's linked stat as a fallback in case the target doesn't have the state involved.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_behavior
TunableVariant.description: What to do if the given object doesn't have the state in question.

TunableEnum.name: operator
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to use.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value to compare to.

TunableTuple.name: statistic
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether or not a statistic is at a certain threshold for a given participant. It can also test whether or not the participant has the statistic explicitly added on them.

Tunable.name: must_have_stat
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sim actually has the statistic referenced. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sim had the statistic at the value of 0

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

TunableTuple.description: Use the raw points for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: Use the rank value for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: user_value
TunableTuple.description: Use the user value for the comparison in the test.

Tunable.name: highest_level_reached_instead
Tunable.description: If checked this will test against the highest level reached. This currently only works with Ranked Statistics. Other statistics do not have a notion of highest level reached. If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The stat we are operating on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.description: The state threshold for this test.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: time_of_day
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the current time falls within the tuned range and/or is on a valid day.

TunableVariant.name: days_available
TunableVariant.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableVariant.name: is_day
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows you to only pass the test if it's either day or night, as per the Region's tuned sunrise and sunset times.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
If checked, this test will only pass if all other criteria are met and it's currently day time (between the sunrise and sunset times tuned for the current region).
If unchecked, this test will only pass if all other criteria are met and it's currently night time (between the sunset and sunrise times tune for the current region).

TunableVariant.name: time_range
TunableVariant.description: The time the test is valid. If days_available is tuned and the time range spans across two days with the second day tuned as unavailable, the test will pass for that day until time range is invalid. Example: Time range 20:00 - 4:00, Monday is valid, Tuesday is invalid. Tuesday at 2:00 the test passes. Tuesday at 4:01 the test fails.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The time the test is valid. If days_available is tuned and the time range spans across two days with the second day tuned as unavailable, the test will pass for that day until time range is invalid. Example: Time range 20:00 - 4:00, Monday is valid, Tuesday is invalid. Tuesday at 2:00 the test passes. Tuesday at 4:01 the test fails.

TunableTuple.name: begin_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableTuple.name: duration
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description: Test to require a Sim to have or not have certain specific traits.

Tunable.name: apply_thresholds_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description:
If checked then Num Whitelist Required and Num Blacklist Allowed will be applied to each individual participant from the subject. If unchecked then it will apply the values to the total whitelist and blacklist matches on the group.
IMPORTANT!!! In the case of objectives this should probably be set to false since we know that this is coming from only one sim and that we want to use the value that comes out of the test result numeric. This isn't just locked to being this value since there are valid cases within that system when you are looking at a group of sims and could want to test that one of your sims passes. Ex. Having a ghost sim in the household.

TunableList.name: blacklist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to not have traits of these types to pass this test. Should Num Blacklist Allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

TunableList.name: blacklist_traits
TunableList.description: The is required to not have traits from this list in order to pass this test. Should num_blacklist_allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

Tunable.description: A blacklist trait.

Tunable.name: num_blacklist_allowed
Tunable.description: The threshold of blacklist traits owned by the specified Sim that will trigger a test failure.

Tunable.name: num_whitelist_required
Tunable.description: The number of whitelist traits that the specified Sim is required to have in order to pass this test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits with these types in order to pass the test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_traits
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits from this list in order to pass the test.

Tunable.description: A whitelist trait. Please note: for pack-safe entries that are not loaded, the game will behave as if the entry doesn't exist. This allows you to specify a pack trait and required count of 1 and always fail the test should the appropriate pack not be installed.

TunableTuple.name: zone
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests properties of a particular zone.

TunableVariant.name: zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Which zone we want to test.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableTuple.name: zone_tests
TunableTuple.description: The tests we wish to run on the zone in question.

TunableVariant.name: business_tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the specified zone is a business or not.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: Test if the zone is a business, an open business, or a closed business.

TunableTuple.name: is_business
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is a business or not.

TunableTuple.name: is_business_open
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is an open business.

TunableVariant.name: is_apartment
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment. Useful in aspiration tuning, to discriminate between property types in tests of lot value. Allows "Own a House worth X" and "Own an Apartment worth X"

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_apartment_zone
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not Apartment Zone
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the zone is an apartment or not.

Tunable.name: consider_penthouse_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider penthouses to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: is_apartment
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment.

TunableVariant.name: is_penthouse
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the current zone is a penthouse.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the zone must be a penthouse. If unchecked, the zone cannot be a penthouse.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

TunableVariant.name: venue_tier
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify that the zone's venue is at the tuned tier. If "no valid tier" is selected, this test will be True if either the current venue doesn't have tiers or if it does but it doesn't currently meet any of their requirements.

Tunable.name: tier_number
Tunable.description: The index of the tier to test. This test will return true if this tier is active and false otherwise. This should be the index of the tier in the tier list and not any player-facing index. For instance, if a tier list had a single tier, that tier would be 0, and if a second tier were added, that second tier would be 1.

TunableVariant.name: venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the zone's venue type is allowed or disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The zone's venue type must pass the whitelist and blacklist to pass the test.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.
